business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks see decline in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 68.48 points to 85,693.53, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.35 points to 26,313.20 as of 9:23 am.
Air India may part ways with CEO Campbell Wilson in leadership reset: ReportGroup chairman N Chandrasekaran has spoken with chief executives of at least two large airlines based in the UK and the US.

Venezuela cuts crude output as US oil blockade chokes storageCaracas is in political crisis under an interim government after President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces on Saturday. The OPEC country's oil exports, its main source of revenue, are now at a standstill following a US blockade on tankers under sanctions and the seizure of two oil cargoes last month.

US control of Venezuelan oil could unlock $1 billion in dues for India, lift outputA US-led takeover or restructuring of Venezuela's oil sector could help India recover nearly $1 billion in long-pending dues and revive crude production from fields operated by ONGC Videsh, analysts and industry sources said.

Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

Cigarettes to cost more from February 1. Here's how new rates will be decidedThe new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Missed the revised ITR filing deadline? Know what happens to tax refundIn most cases, refunds are issued within a few weeks to a few months. Delays may occur due to mismatches in TDS details, bank account validation issues, or cases selected for scrutiny.

ITC shares tumble 4%, down 13% in 2 days: Buy the dip or stay away?The sharp sell-off comes after the finance ministry revised the taxation structure for cigarettes, effective February 1, 2026. Here is all you need to know.

MCX shares crash 80% in early deals, but the fall is not what it seemsMCX shares fell by more than 80% on trading screens on Friday, hitting an intraday low of Rs 2,192 on the BSE. This was compared with Thursday's closing price of Rs 10,988.60.

Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India shares in focus. Here's whyDevyani International shares were trading at Rs 152.80, up Rs 5.37 or 3.64% during the morning session as of 9:39 am. In contrast, Sapphire Foods India shares were trading lower at Rs 253.95, down Rs 8.75 or 3.33%.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by auto, metal stocks as FMCG continues to fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 172.34 points to 85,360.94, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 44.10 points to 26,190.65 as of 9:26 am.

Gold, silver price today: How have precious metals started 2026?Gold and silver prices moved higher on Friday, recovering part of the losses seen late last week, even as investors looked back at the historic gains these metals delivered through 2025.

Is 10-minute delivery really unsafe? Zomato CEO answers after gig workers strikeWhile delivery services on platforms such as Zomato and Blinkit were largely unaffected on New Year's Eve, questions around whether 10-minute delivery models put pressure on riders gained traction on social media.

If system was unfair...: Deepinder Goyal as Zomato unaffected by gig workers' strikeZomato and its quick-commerce arm Blinkit recorded their highest-ever single-day orders on New Year's Eve, delivering over 75 lakh orders despite a nationwide gig workers' strike. Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said such scale shows a system seen as unfair cannot consistently attract or retain workers.

Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

entertainment.headline: Dhurandhar box office Day 31: Ranveer-Akshaye's film sets new record, beats KGF 2 Aditya Dhar's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become the fifth Indian film to surpass the Rs 1200 crore mark at the global box office. The film overtook the lifetime collection of 'KGF Chapter 2'.

Archana Puran Singh's son Aaryamann gets Rs 2.12 lakh guitar as gift, video viral Archana Puran Singh orchestrates a family treasure hunt in London for her son Aaryamann's 30th birthday, culminating in a Martin & Co. OOO-15M guitar gifted by his fiancee Yogita Bihani.

Vijay's fans tear down Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi poster amid box office battle Supporters of Vijay tore down Parasakthi posters in Madurai as tensions rose between fans of the actor's final film Jana Nayagan and Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi during the Pongal release week.

The pan-India mix: Pairing Bollywood and South film stars drives 2026 box office Bollywood and South stars team up in 2026 as never before. Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi in Ramayana, Prabhas and Triptii Dimri in Spirit, Kartik Aaryan and Sreeleela in Anurag Basu's film, and Yash and Kiara Advani in Toxic are examples.

Singer Ariana Grande teases a return to touring after six years Singer Ariana Grande shared new details about her upcoming Eternal Sunshine Tour and reflected on her experiences at the 2026 Critics Choice Awards, marking her return to the public eye after a six-year touring hiatus.

Deepika Padukone cuts cake to Aankhon Mein Teri at pre-birthday bash. Watch video Bollywood actor Deepika Padukone marked her 40th birthday by hosting a pre-birthday celebration with fans in Mumbai. The event featured cake-cutting, fan interactions, and viral social media moments.

Korean actor Ahn Sung Ki dies at 74 after battle with blood cancer Korean actor Ahn Sung Ki died on January 5 following a recurrence of blood cancer. His career spanning nearly seven decades included more than 170 films.

Critics Choice Awards winners list: Adolescence, One Battle After Another win big Honouring achievements in global film and television, the 31st Critics Choice Awards recognised standout performances and technical excellence. Take a look at the winners here.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan vs Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi: Which film has the edge? Vijay's farewell film Jana Nayagan releases on January 9, followed by Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi on January 10. Both films carry political themes and will compete fiercely for 2026 Pongal box office supremacy.

Aishwarya-Abhishek greet paps after New Year getaway with Aaradhya. Watch Aishwarya Rai, along with Abhishek Bachchan and Aaradhy, returned to Mumbai after their low-key New Year celebration in New York. Pictures and videos of the trio arriving at the airport have emerged online.

Miley Cyrus teases special plans to celebrate 20th anniversary of Hannah Montana Miley Cyrus confirmed plans for a special tribute to mark two decades since 'Hannah Montana' premiered. She even debuted her show-inspired hair transformation at a recent event.

Nayak 2: Anil Kapoor to act in and produce sequel, says co-producer Deepak Mukut Nayak: The Real Hero is officially getting a sequel around 25 years after its release. Lead actor Anil Kapoor returns to produce and act in Nayak 2.

Actor Sudha Chandran loses control of emotions at bhajan night, video goes viral Sudha Chandran's video from a bhajan night has gone viral, showing the veteran actor overwhelmed with emotions during the devotional event.

Border 2 actor Medha Rana says Ghar Kab Aaoge song is a tribute to those who wait Border 2 debutant Medha Rana shared a heartfelt note on the emotional depth of the song Ghar Kab Aaoge, calling it a tribute not just to soldiers but also to the families who wait for them.
BTS announce 5th studio album and world tour. Details BTS have officially announced their fifth studio album and a world tour, marking their first full-group comeback in three years and nine months.

Anurag Kashyap reviews Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar: It's his politics Anurag Kashyap has shared his review of Dhurandhar, praising Aditya Dhar's filmmaking and Ranveer Singh's performance while disagreeing with a few dialogues.

Bigg Boss Marathi fame Jay Dudhane arrested over real estate fraud allegation Reality TV star Jay Dudhane was arrested at Mumbai airport in an alleged Rs 4.61 crore real estate fraud case involving mortgaged commercial shops in Thane.

Anupam Kher welcomes Ravi Kishan to Khosla Ka Ghosla 2, calls him a brilliant actor Anupam Kher announced the start of Khosla Ka Ghosla 2 and welcomed Ravi Kishan to the cast, calling him a "brilliant actor".

Ashnoor Kaur says her Bigg Boss 19 moments were cut off, calls out unfair editing Ashnoor Kaur shared that many of her important moments and fights inside the Bigg Boss 19 house were cut during editing, which affected how audiences perceived her contribution. She said the narrative against her was shaped largely by what was not shown on screen.

general news.headline: PM Modi knew I wasn't happy: Trump hints at new tariffs over Russian oilAddressing reporters on board Air Force One on Sunday, Trump said, "PM Modi's a very good man. He's a good guy. He knew I was not happy. It was important to make me happy. They do trade, and we can raise tariffs on them very quickly."

Indian woman found dead in boyfriend's Maryland apartment, he flees to IndiaArjun Sharma filed a complaint on January 2, stating that his girlfriend, Nikitha Godishala, had been missing since New Year's Eve. Police later found Godishala's body in Sharma's Columbia flat.

We're in charge: Trump warns of more Venezuela strikes if leaders don't 'behave'  Live UpdatesUS President Donald Trump has warned of a possible second military strike in Venezuela if the interim leadership does not comply with American demands. The situation has escalated tensions in the region following the seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

Elon Musk's 'lovely dinner' with Trump, Melania brings back bromance buzzElon Musk and President Donald Trump's relationship soured after the Tesla CEO's criticism of the administration's One Big Beautiful Bill, a major tax and spending legislation.

From the Editor-in-Chief | 50th Anniversary SpecialFor five decades, INDIA TODAY has chronicled without fear or favour, and without a break, the nation's trials and tribulations, neither avoiding its tensions nor contradictions, but continuously reinventing itself.
Air India may part ways with CEO Campbell Wilson in leadership reset: ReportGroup chairman N Chandrasekaran has spoken with chief executives of at least two large airlines based in the UK and the US.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 10 | Gods, Kings & Grammar: Sangam's Shift from Sacred to SecularWhat concerns us here is not geography or geology, but grammar — how a civilisation understood itself before it theologised itself.

Lady Singham, who confronted TVK leader seeking more crowd at rally, transferredDuring actor Vijay's Puducherry rally, IPS officer Isha Singh was seen snatching the mic from Bussy Anand mid-announcement. The fierce officer has now been transferred to Delhi.

Watch: Strange pillars of light seen falling from space in RussiaStunning light pillars illuminated the night sky north of St. Petersburg, Russia, in a breathtaking natural display in January 2026. This optical phenomenon turns freezing air into a canvas of vertical glowing beams.

Manipur woman stabs South Korean live-in partner to death in Greater NoidaA late-night drinking session in Greater Noida turned tragic when a South Korean national was fatally stabbed by his live-in partner from Manipur. The police have arrested the woman and are investigating the circumstances surrounding the incident.

Stop your threats, Greenland is not for sale, Denmark tells TrumpDenmark and Greenland strongly oppose US President Trump's remarks on acquiring Greenland. Trump heightened controversy over Greenland last month when he named Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry as special envoy to the territory.

Novak Djokovic quits tennis player body he founded in shock exitNovak Djokovic co-founded the PTPA to give players a stronger, independent voice in how the sport is run. Six years on, he has stepped away from the organisation, saying concerns over transparency mean it no longer reflects his values.

The pan-India mix: Pairing Bollywood and South film stars drives 2026 box officeBollywood and South stars team up in 2026 as never before. Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi in Ramayana, Prabhas and Triptii Dimri in Spirit, Kartik Aaryan and Sreeleela in Anurag Basu's film, and Yash and Kiara Advani in Toxic are examples.

Supreme Court verdict on Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam bail pleas todayA Supreme Court bench had reserved its judgment in December after marathon hearings on the bail pleas of Umar Khalid, scholar Sharjeel Imam and five other accused in the Delhi riots case. The court will announce its verdict today.

Watch: Kolkata cab driver drops drunk woman home safe, viral video wins heartsThe video, reportedly recorded on a dashboard camera, shows a 31-year-old cab driver, named Munna Ajij Mollick, ensuring the safety of a young female passenger, who appears to be heavily intoxicated.

Sounds good to me: After Venezuela, Trump threatens military op against ColombiaSpeaking aboard Air Force One, Trump said a US operation against Colombia "sounds good to me", accusing President Gustavo Petro's government of producing and exporting cocaine to the United States.

This roadside stop became famous for just one dish: LangchaThere's a certain stretch where both sides of the road line up with sweet shops stacked back-to-back, each promising the same thing: Langcha. This is Shaktigarh, or what most travellers now simply recognise as the place to stop for this delectable sweet.

Live: Cuban govt says 32 citizens allegedly killed during US raid on VenezuelaUS–Venezuela Tensions Live Updates: The turmoil in Venezuela continues a day after the country's ousted President Nicolás Maduro was captured at the hands of US troops in Operation Absolute Resolve. As per the direction of the Venezuelan Supreme Court, Delcy Rodriguez, the country's former Vice President, took charge as the Interim President. Rodriguez, a leader with a strong leftist background, earlier expressed her solidarity with Maduro and acknowledged him as the only administrative head of the country. Meanwhile, the US has issued a fresh threat to Rodriguez, citing that she would face grave consequences if she does not follow the right path. Washington on Monday also took a U-turn from its earlier position, saying that it would not govern Venezuela as Trump claimed earlier. Follow indiatoday.com to get all the live updates.

On CCTV, man walks up behind AAP sarpanch, shoots him in head at Punjab weddingA wedding in Amritsar turned tragic as an Aam Aadmi Party sarpanch was shot dead during the celebrations, captured on CCTV. The incident has raised serious concerns over political violence in Punjab.

Vijay's fans tear down Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi poster amid box office battleSupporters of Vijay tore down Parasakthi posters in Madurai as tensions rose between fans of the actor's final film Jana Nayagan and Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi during the Pongal release week.

These Indians studied at Harvard 100 years ago, long before studying abroad became a thingThe Kosambi family were among the earliest Indians to study and teach at Harvard University. Their journey highlights challenges faced and contributions made to global education and Indian historiography.

Are exams killing the habit of reading for understanding?As India debates learning outcomes and skill readiness, a quieter crisis is unfolding in classrooms, students are reading less for comprehension and more for survival. The trend is prompting questions about attention spans, assessment models, and the future of learning.

Paisa-wasool mentality turning Indian holidays into headachesTravel is meant to be an escape from the mundane of daily life — a chance to relax, unwind, and return rejuvenated. For many Indians, however, holidays often turn into checklist-driven exercises, leaving people to return home not refreshed, but anxious and exhausted.
How the US pulled off the daring abduction of Nicolas MaduroAn extraordinary US special forces mission exorcises the ghosts of past failures.

sports.headline: Novak Djokovic quits tennis player body he founded in shock exit Novak Djokovic co-founded the PTPA to give players a stronger, independent voice in how the sport is run. Six years on, he has stepped away from the organisation, saying concerns over transparency mean it no longer reflects his values.

Report: Bangladesh Cricket Board Seeks Hybrid Model For T20 World Cup In India In this transcript, an unidentified speaker discusses the Bangladesh Cricket Board's (BCB) request for a 'hybrid model' for the T20 World Cup. The speaker states that the board is ready to play India but prefers matches to be moved out of the country due to safety concerns for players. The individual mentions that the decision is influenced by government directives and cites the release of a player, likely Mustafizur Rahman, from the IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for security reasons. The speaker also notes that the team was scheduled to play three games in Kolkata and one in Mumbai.

RR to play in Pune? State board approaches BCCI to retain IPL matches in Jaipur Rajasthan Cricket Association has stepped in to protect Rajasthan Royals' Jaipur base. With uncertainty over IPL 2026 venues, the RCA has formally urged the BCCI to keep RR home games at Sawai Mansingh Stadium.

Messi vs Ronaldo: Will FIFA World Cup 2026 be the stage for a final GOAT battle? Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo will lock horns once again, this time under the bright lights of the World Cup. With their careers set to come to a close, can the GOATS deliver one final magical performance for Argentina and Portugal respectively?

MS Dhoni is my brother from another mother: Dwayne Bravo opens up on CSK bond Dwayne Bravo revealed how MS Dhoni's trust shaped his role at Chennai Super Kings. By keeping things simple and backing his players, Dhoni built an environment that helped CSK succeed consistently in the IPL.

Ruben Amorim's jibe hints at off-field tensions at Manchester United after Leeds draw Ruben Amorim's post-match comments overshadowed Manchester United's draw at Leeds. By stressing he is a manager and not just a coach, Amorim publicly exposed growing tension with the club's hierarchy.

Joe Root goes level with Ricky Ponting after 2nd Ashes 100 in Australia Joe Root's SCG century pushed him level with Ricky Ponting on the all-time Test list. The hundred underlined his dominance in the Ashes and England's strong position in the series finale.

Desert Vipers clinch ILT20 title after Sam Curran pulls off MVP show Sam Curran crowned a flawless ILT20 campaign as Desert Vipers finally converted consistency into long-awaited silverware. A dominant final display confirmed their supremacy and ended years of near-misses on Dubai's biggest night under lights Sunday.

Bangladesh cricket official explains call to not play T20 World Cup in India T20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have requested the ICC to move their matches from India to Sri Lanka. BCB director Faruque Ahmed explains to India Today how the country's cricket board arrived at that decision.

Jay Shah's mission Olympics: Want 100 medals from India in 2036 Former BCCI president Jay Shah wants a 100 medals from India in the 2036 Olympics. Shah, who now heads the ICC made his statements during the Run for Girl Child Half Marathon in Surat.

No rings on Day 1: National Boxing Championship delayed after logistical nightmareA chaotic, ringless start delayed the National Boxing Championships by over four hours, leaving boxers waiting in uncertainty as logistical lapses disrupted what was meant to be a landmark opening day.

Bondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed gets standing ovation from sold-out SCGBondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed was honoured by the Sydney Cricket Ground on Day 1 of the final Ashes Test match. Al-Ahmed had risked his life to save civilians when two armed men opened fire at Bondi Beach on December 14, 2025.

IPL Controversy: BCB Cites Security Threats And Demands Relocation Of World Cup Games To Sri LankaIn this special broadcast, the focus is on the escalating diplomatic and sporting tension between India and Bangladesh. The controversy stems from the Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise Kolkata Knight Riders reportedly releasing Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman following political pressure. In a retaliatory move, the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has officially requested the International Cricket Council (ICC) to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, citing security concerns. The programme features a discussion on the implications of this decision, comparing it to Pakistan's stance, and explores whether politics is overshadowing the spirit of the game. Experts debate if this sets a dangerous precedent for global sports and if the IPL brand value could suffer due to such geopolitical exclusions.

BJP Calls Shah Rukh Khan 'Traitor' For Signing Bangladeshi Pacer; BCB Cites Safety Fears For BoycottIn a major geopolitical escalation affecting cricket, the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has announced it will not travel to India for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. The decision follows the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) instructing the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) to release Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman from their squad. The BCCI cited 'recent developments' and safety concerns for the directive. The move has triggered a political storm, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) criticizing KKR co-owner Shah Rukh Khan. Former Bangladesh captain Mohammad Ashraful, speaking exclusively to India Today, expressed sadness over the developments.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning appointed as new UP Warriorz captainThe Australian legend, Meg Lanning is set to take over as the captain of the UP Warriorz franchise ahead of the 2026 edition of the Women's Premier League

Atul Wassan Backs BCCI: 'Eye For An Eye' Stance Right on Bangladesh T20 World Cup ThreatFormer India cricketer **Atul Wassan** supports the BCCI's decision to exclude Mustafizur Rahman from IPL 2026, calling it a justified response to public sentiment. Speaking on the Bangladesh Cricket Board's (BCB) threat to boycott T20 World Cup matches in India, Wassan dismisses it as "shadow boxing" and argues that Indian cricket will not be isolated. NTV Sports Editor Barshan Kabir also joins to discuss the political pressure behind the BCB's stance.

Atul Wassan Defends Shah Rukh Khan Amid Row Over KKR Dropping Bangladeshi PlayerIn a discussion on the diplomatic fallout affecting cricket, former Indian cricketer Atul Wassan weighs in on the controversy surrounding the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and the Indian Premier League (IPL). Wassan argues that targeting KKR co-owner Shah Rukh Khan for the franchise's initial bid for a Bangladeshi player is 'totally wrong' and 'unfair,' describing the actor as a 'low-hanging fruit' for public sentiment. He contends that while the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) may have taken the right step given the current 'political turmoil' and attacks on minorities in Bangladesh, removing a single player is merely 'shadow boxing' and will not solve the broader issues. The show, hosted by Nikhil Naz, also touches on the Bangladesh Cricket Board's request to move matches to Sri Lanka and the revocation of No Objection Certificates (NOCs) for players.

Tyson Fury set to come out of boxing retirement in 2026Former world heavyweight champion Tyson Fury declared his return from retirement, igniting renewed speculation about a long-awaited bout with Anthony Joshua. Fury's career has been marked by dramatic highs, retirements, and a string of major victories.

Debate: BCB Refuses To Play T20 World Cup In India Citing Security And Political TensionsOn this Special Report, the focus is on the major decision by the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to not play the T20 World Cup on Indian soil. The move follows the exclusion of pacer Mustafizur Rahman from the Indian Premier League (IPL) due to security concerns. A former India cricketer supports the BCCI's stance, citing public sentiment, while a guest from Bangladesh highlights the political pressure driving the BCB's decision. The programme explores the 'tit-for-tat' dynamics and the potential isolation of cricket teams amidst rising political tensions.

Bangladesh Asks ICC to Move T20 World Cup Matches From India Citing Security ThreatsA major controversy is brewing in the world of cricket, as reported by India Today. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has officially requested the International Cricket Council (ICC) to move all of its T20 World Cup matches out of India, citing 'security threats to some of their players'. This development follows the recent controversy where Bangladeshi player Mustafizur Rahman was released by his IPL franchise, Kolkata Knight Riders, reportedly under pressure on the BCCI. The BCB's request mirrors a similar move by Pakistan, which has already arranged for its matches to be played in the tournament's joint-host nation, Sri Lanka. The ICC has not yet made a decision on the BCB's request to have its matches rescheduled in Sri Lanka.

ICC open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup games out of India: ReportThe ICC is open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches out of India. The move comes after Bangladesh registered an official request to move their games out of India in the aftermath of Mustafizur Rahman controversy.

Usman Tariq defends controversial action, calls critics illiteratePakistan spinner Usman Tariq has defended his controversial action. While his critics continue to allege that he chucks the ball, the spinner has said that illiteracy can kill knowledge.

Hardik Pandya, India's X-factor in India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad: De VilliersAB de Villiers has backed Hardik Pandya as India's key match-winner for the T20 World Cup, praising his ability to change games with both bat and ball and calling him a pivotal figure.

PM Narendra Modi says India are preparing with full strength to host 2036 OlympicsPrime Minister Narendra Modi outlines India's strengthened preparations to host the 2036 Olympics, with a renewed focus on athlete opportunities, policy reforms, and infrastructure expansion, as demonstrated at the 72nd Senior National Volleyball Championship in Varanasi.

Zak Crawley frustrates the life out of me: Michael Vaughan tears into England batterMichael Vaughan criticised Zak Crawley's lapses in concentration after another soft dismissal in the Sydney Test but insisted the England opener still has far more to offer and should continue to be backed.

Sarfaraz Khan's fitness concerns leaves Mumbai's knockout push at risk: ReportMumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy knockout hopes are under threat after a heavy loss to Maharashtra, compounded by Sarfaraz Khan's quadriceps injury, NRR concerns, and a tense finish to the group stage.

RCB, RR set to play IPL matches in Pune? Teams inspect stadiumRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals have visited the MCA Stadium in Pune as contingency preparations ahead of the IPL season. Both franchises are facing logistical hurdles in hosting matches at their respective home venues, prompting them to explore alternative options.

T20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh Seeks Venue Shift To Sri Lanka After Mustafizur Rahman's IPL ExitIn this Special Report, India Today's Principal Correspondent Anirban Sinha Roy details the escalating cricketing diplomatic row as Bangladesh refuses to travel to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup. The decision follows the Bangladesh Interim Government's directive to the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to seek a venue shift to Sri Lanka. The move comes after the BCCI reportedly asked Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), co-owned by Shah Rukh Khan, to drop Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman, citing attacks on Hindus in the neighbouring country. Bangladesh's Sports Adviser Asif Nazrul termed the BCCI's stance a 'communal policy' in a social media post. The report highlights the logistical challenges for the ICC, with matches originally scheduled at Kolkata's Eden Gardens now in limbo.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup snub leaves Ponting stunned: I couldn't believe thatShubman Gill's omission from India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2026 has left Ricky Ponting stunned. Yet the legendary Australian captain admitted that such is the depth that Indian cricket possesses currently.

Ashes: Former England captain urges Test mindset shift after rain-hit Sydney TestMichael Vaughan questioned Test cricket's approach after rain and bad light cut short Day 1 at Sydney. With thousands in attendance, the former England captain urged officials to rethink decisions that denied fans valuable playing time.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
